comments.body: Is that really correct?  (i.e. Isn't CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD=17 requires -std=c++1z on some compiler?)
We moved to require `c++17` in commit 95e8bb819ce8b2d7d6a0a804de26317d3340e2fe.

Okay ... are we saying that we will not support any compiler/standard pair that is not fully numerical? (i.e. so no 20 support until the compiler officially use --std=c++20)?  [That is a valid choice that ought to be 'documented' somewhere and imply that we do not support experimenting with upcoming standard, only established ones ... or am I missing something]

No, but that's the status quo. We only support C++11, 14, and 17. Support for C++20 will require more work than just adding the flag in root-config, as was the case for C++17 due to removed things from older C++ standards, etc.
